body:
## Description
This PR adds support for the HOBEIAN 10G Human Motion Sensor Tuya Zigbee MmWave Radar Detector with Temperature, Humidity, and Luminance sensors.

## Device Information
- **Manufacturer ID**: _TZE200_rhgsbacq
- **Model**: TS0601
- **Product**: HOBEIAN 10G Human Motion Sensor with multi-sensors

## Implementation Details
- Added new driver: `radar_sensor_multi`
- Uses HOBEIAN ZG-204ZV profile datapoints (verified from Hubitat driver)
- Supports 4 capabilities:
  - Motion detection (DP 1)
  - Temperature in ┬░C (DP 111, value/10)
  - Humidity in % (DP 101, value/10)
  - Luminance in lux (DP 106)

## Testing
- Tested on physical device
- All capabilities working correctly
- Clean production code without debug logging
- Version bumped to 0.2.74

## Reference
Datapoint mappings verified against: https://github.com/kkossev/Hubitat/blob/deviceProfileV4/Drivers/Tuya%20Zigbee%20mmWave%20Sensor/deviceProfilesV4_mmWave.json
title: Add support for Radar Multi-Sensor (10G) - _TZE200_rhgsbacq
Add support for pir  tze200 y8jijhba

body:
Sorry Johan I could not make it splitting in to PR somehow. I am not totally friends with git yet.
Good that chatgpt is around, otherwise it would have taken some time I think:-).

These 2 drivers are orthogonal except for that the garage door controller has a new Tuya datapoint and the fan/light switch has a new flow card to be able to set the fan speed, but also to be able to display the speed set on the device tile.
The garage door controller I model as a lock to be able to display in the device tile if the door is open or closed.

The 2 new tuya devices I have added support for are:

fan_light_switch_tuya: TS0601_TZE204_lawxy9e2
garage_door_controller: TS0601 _TZE204_nklqjk62
title: Addition of Garage Door Controller and combined Fan on/off, fan speed, Light on/off drivers.

body:
The current driver does not work, it also has three issues:


- The bot does not report battery
- The bot only has one mode
- The bot identifies as a simple plug or button

I modelled the driver after a plug and now it works :)
title: Make fingerbot (_TZ3210_j4pdtz9v) work

body:
Button action was not identified correctly.
LongPress added as button action.
Changed icon and pictures.
++++++++++++++
The identification of the button action did not work.
The best result was achieved by identifying the number 253 in the frame.data. The next number in the frame.data reflects the button action (see also smart_remote_1_button, with the difference that the position in the frame.data has shifted from [1] to [3]).
This version is tested extensively.
Unfortunately I could not get the battery measurement reporting to work. Probably because this is a "sleeping" device.

I did not change the coding regarding the handling of cluster-id 8. Although I suspect that the dimming capabilities are only working if a touchlink connection is established.

See also Issues #1011 and #1026 .

body:
Driver for the Tuya RB-SRAIN01 solar rain sensor. The functionality of this driver matches the drivers in ZHA and Zigbee2MQTT.

The rain intensity is a bit odd, as it is reported in millivolts, for details, see for example [this review](https://smarthomescene.com/reviews/tuya-zigbee-solar-rain-sensor-rb-srain01-review/).
title: Added Rain sensor _TZ3210_tgvtvdoc / TS0207

body:
The dimmer value has two bugs:
1) Homey flows works much better with a 0-1 base, and according to the docs it should not be minus. Thus you can detect plus/minus depending on the direction turned.
2) The dim reported from the device is 250 per half-turn (as in 500 per one rotation). So the value should be divided by 500.
NOTE: The device is speed-sensitive. A full rotation is max 500 when turning it very fast and minimum 25 if going slow... 100 is the "normal speed"
title: Bugfix: Fix TZ3000_abrsvsou dimmer

body:
Adds support for the _TZ3210_up3pngle / TS0205 smoke detector.

The device uses the IASZone cluster for smoke, tamper and battery alarms.
For the battery level status it uses the PowerConfiguration cluster.
Therefore, the proposed device driver uses these two clusters to update the Homey device functions.

There are several issues that relate to or require the implementation of this device:
#483 
#543 
#736 
#776
title: Support for smoke detector _TZ3210_up3pngle / TS0205
Add missing manufacturer for TS0203 door/window sensor

body:
This PR is what is seems, it support two channel curtain module (like `j1xl73iw`). As it requires a submodule to control both channels, I created a new device folder for it.

Any comments are welcome. 

I have one issue that I might need to change: on the primary module, the state states `UP` and `DOWN` and set position work correctly, but the `OPEN` and `CLOSE` do not. On the submodule, all three methods work well. 

Still, it does the job, up and down works, set to % also. 

This will fix #362 as well
title: Add support for 2 channel/gang curtain module j1xl73iw

Thanks to @robertklep for help with response code.

body:
Not sure if they've released different versions under the same manufacturer name, but the existing driver didn't work.

With this:

- Don't attempt to configure reporting (unsupported general command)
- Remove the alarm_tamper capability (not seen anything about this being supported and only see the alarm being reported)
- Implement the onZoneStatusChangeNotification
- Keep the measure_battery capability and implement it by periodical polling
- Remove the alarm_battery capability as per the best practices which says never to implement both this and measure_battery

Caveat emptor: I'm new to both Homey and Zigbee so perhaps I'm missing something very obvious or have otherwise done things wrong or in a less than optimal way, but with this the sensor (motion, battery) works. 

As an aside the sensor itself seem very shaky and prone to always report motion in some scenarios (two consecutive status updates with one no-motion followed directly by a motion one). Not sure what is going on there, but seems to be rather common complaint just looking at some reviews.
title: Make motion sensor (TUYATEC-bd5faf9p / Nedis ZBSM10WT) work
